The model is simple and does not contain any additional details or features. **Part 1** Create the base of the model by following these steps: **Coordinate System** Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Extrude the sketch by 0.0577 units towards the normal direction and 0 units in the opposite direction. This will create the base of the model with the specified height, width, and length. **Completion** With the completion of the extrusion, the part is ready. The first part created has a shape of a square with a central hole, a height of 0.0577 units, a width of 0.1154 units, and a length of 0.1154 units. This completes the construction of Part 1. Repeat the steps for the remaining parts with similar instructions. Specify any additional adjustments regarding each part's dimensions or shape as needed. Remember to describe the curves, loops, and faces, as well as provide the height, width, and length for each part and the final shape. Be concise and avoid specific boolean operation terms in the instructions. Start each part's instructions by stating the shape being constructed and provide only the necessary steps for its creation.</description>

The length, width, and height of the part are 0.375, 0.75, and 0.375 units, respectively. The height is half the length of the sides, and all sides are parallel and meet at right angles.</description>

The height, width, and length of each intermediate part are provided in their respective descriptions. Make sure to generate the parametric CAD model according to these instructions.</description>
